intro: Plagiobothrys reticulatus, commonly known as the net-veined bluecurls, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has hairy, glandular leaves. Its flowers are clustered in dense, curling inflorescences, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Plagiobothrys reticulatus is often found in open areas such as gravelly slopes and is adapted to arid environments.
